name: Melatonin

dosing.notes: Take 30-60 minutes before bedtime. Prolonged-release formulation (Circadin) approved for insomnia in patients ≥55. Lower doses (0.5-1 mg) may be as effective as higher doses for sleep. Used for jet lag, shift work disorder, and DSPD.

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Can increase to 3-5 mg if 1 mg ineffective. Evidence limited for doses >10 mg.
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: 3-5 mg nocte for sleep regulation. Safer than benzodiazepines in elderly patients.
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 1-3 mg nocte. Good safety profile for chronic use. Useful in DSPD — take 2-3 h before desired sleep time.
canadian_clinical.max_dose_evidence: 5 mg (approved); up to 10 mg used off-label
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 10 mg/day (off-label); most benefit seen at 1-5 mg.

warnings: Morning drowsiness / next-day sedation at higher doses
Interaction with warfarin (may enhance anticoagulant effect)
Interaction with fluvoxamine (markedly increases melatonin levels)
Not regulated as a drug in Canada (sold as natural health product) — variable quality
citations: Cochrane Review: Melatonin for Sleep Disorders 2022
